rb_semilinear

📘 Documentation

Open Documentation: https://hannagierling.github.io/rb_semilinear/

or

cd ./docs/_build/html
xdg-open index.html  # linux
open index.html      # macOS

🔧 Requirements

This project uses FEniCS, so please make sure it is installed correctly before running any scripts.

⚠️ Note: FEniCS runs natively on Linux. If you’re using Windows, you must install and use the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL). 👉 See the official WSL installation guide

⬇️ Installing FEniCS

The following instructions are copied from https://fenicsproject.org/download/archive/.

⚠️ Note: We used the Linux-Distribution Pop!_OS and Miniconda.

Anaconda

The easiest (and suggested) way to start using FEniCS on Linux or MacOS systems is to use conda:

conda create -n fenics_env -c conda-forge fenics

➡️ Creates a new Conda environment named fenics_env and installs FEniCS from conda-forge.

conda activate fenics_env

➡️ Activates the environment so you can use FEniCS within it.

Windows

To install FEniCS on Windows, use Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) and install the Ubuntu distribution. Then follow the instructions for Ubuntu (or Anaconda).

Ubuntu

To install FEniCS on Ubuntu, run the following commands:

sudo apt-get install software-properties-common
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:fenics-packages/fenics
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install fenics

▶️ Running the test_ns.py and test_rbm.py Script

To run the test_ns.py and test_rbm.py script:

  1. Activate your Conda environment (If Anaconda was used for installing):

    conda activate fenics_env

  2. Run the script:

    python3 ./test_ns.py
